p: Sweet chestnut trees are usually found at elevations ranging between sea level and 1800 m, although elevations between 700 and 1000 m give the best conditions for fruit production [ 9, 10]. This deciduous species optimally develops in regions with annual mean temperatures between 8 °C and 15 °C, and annual rainfall ranging from 600–700 mm to 1500−1600 mm [ 3, 12, 13, 16]. The previous conditions highlight its preference for warm and humid temperate climates. This explains its prevailing location in high-elevation areas in Southern Europe, as Mediterranean-type climates are commonly excessively warm and dry for their optimal growth and development.
